title: Purple Team/Threat Hunting
description: Comprehensive tutorials for detection validation, logging assessment, and threat hunting covering credential theft, cloud control plane abuse, web shells, and advanced hunting methodologies.

steps.title: Detection & Logging Validation
steps.content:
OBJECTIVE: Assess and validate security control effectiveness

STEP-BY-STEP PROCESS:
1. Review SIEM/log aggregation configurations
2. Test detection rule coverage and accuracy
3. Validate alert generation and response workflows

WHAT TO LOOK FOR:
- Log source completeness
- Detection rule gaps
- Alert fatigue indicators

steps.title: Credential Theft Hunting
steps.content:
OBJECTIVE: Hunt for credential access and theft activities

STEP-BY-STEP PROCESS:
1. Monitor for LSASS access patterns
2. Detect pass-the-hash/token manipulation
3. Identify Kerberoasting and ASREPRoasting attempts

WHAT TO LOOK FOR:
- Memory dumping artifacts
- Authentication anomalies
- Ticket request patterns

steps.title: Cloud Control Plane Abuse Detection
steps.content:
OBJECTIVE: Identify cloud infrastructure manipulation

STEP-BY-STEP PROCESS:
1. Monitor IAM policy changes and privilege escalation
2. Detect resource creation/abuse patterns
3. Identify data exfiltration via cloud services

WHAT TO LOOK FOR:
- Unusual API calls
- Resource creation spikes
- Cross-account access

steps.title: Web Shell Detection & Response
steps.content:
OBJECTIVE: Find and remediate web shell deployments

STEP-BY-STEP PROCESS:
1. Scan for anomalous web files and scripts
2. Monitor for command execution patterns
3. Validate file integrity and permissions

WHAT TO LOOK FOR:
- Unexpected file modifications
- Command execution from web processes
- Network beaconing

steps.title: Log Analysis Fundamentals
steps.content:
OBJECTIVE: Master log analysis for threat detection

STEP-BY-STEP PROCESS:
1. Understand log formats and sources
2. Implement log parsing and correlation
3. Create hunting hypotheses and queries

WHAT TO LOOK FOR:
- Log parsing errors
- Correlation rule effectiveness
- Query performance issues

steps.title: Sigma Rule Development
steps.content:
OBJECTIVE: Create and test Sigma detection rules

STEP-BY-STEP PROCESS:
1. Map threat behaviors to Sigma format
2. Test rules against log samples
3. Deploy and monitor rule effectiveness

WHAT TO LOOK FOR:
- Rule syntax errors
- False positive rates
- Detection coverage gaps

steps.title: YARA Signature Creation
steps.content:
OBJECTIVE: Develop YARA rules for file-based hunting

STEP-BY-STEP PROCESS:
1. Analyze malware samples and IOCs
2. Create YARA signatures with conditions
3. Test and refine rules against datasets

WHAT TO LOOK FOR:
- Signature collision issues
- Performance impact
- Detection accuracy

steps.title: Network Traffic Analysis
steps.content:
OBJECTIVE: Hunt threats through network telemetry

STEP-BY-STEP PROCESS:
1. Analyze flow logs and packet captures
2. Identify anomalous communication patterns
3. Correlate network and host indicators

WHAT TO LOOK FOR:
- Unusual port usage
- Data exfiltration attempts
- C2 communication

steps.title: Endpoint Detection Validation
steps.content:
OBJECTIVE: Test and improve EDR effectiveness

STEP-BY-STEP PROCESS:
1. Execute known techniques against EDR
2. Monitor detection and response
3. Tune rules and reduce false positives

WHAT TO LOOK FOR:
- Detection gaps
- Alert quality issues
- Response effectiveness

steps.title: Threat Hunting Methodology
steps.content:
OBJECTIVE: Implement structured threat hunting programs

STEP-BY-STEP PROCESS:
1. Define hunting hypotheses and triggers
2. Execute hunts using multiple data sources
3. Document findings and improve detections

WHAT TO LOOK FOR:
- Hypothesis validation
- Data source coverage
- Process improvement opportunities
